question.title: Execution fails when run by Lwjgl3Launcher
question.body:
I've created a new project by using LibGDX liftoff. Everything is okay when I first run the project (i.e. it displays libgdx's logo), but when I test my first animation, the project crashes and this is the error message I get:

Execution failed for task ':lwjgl3:com.example.game.lwjgl3.Lwjgl3Launcher.main()'. Process 'command 'D:\Application\Nam 2 - HK 2 - Lap trinh di dong\Android studio\setup\jbr\bin\java.exe'' finished with non-zero exit value 1

The confusing thing is, my animation worked properly before, but it fails when I do the same this time.

public class MainGame extends ApplicationAdapter {
    private SpriteBatch batch;
    private Texture image;
    private Texture slimeSheet;
    private TextureRegion[] slimeIdleFrames;
    private TextureRegion currentFrame;
    private Animation slimeAnimation;

    float stateTime;
    private static final int FRAME_COLS = 2;
    private static final int FRAME_ROWS = 2;

    @Override
    public void create() {
        batch = new SpriteBatch();
        image = new Texture("libgdx.png");

        slimeSheet = new Texture(Gdx.files.internal("Slime1_Idle.png"));
        TextureRegion[][] tmp = TextureRegion.split(slimeSheet, slimeSheet.getWidth()/FRAME_COLS, slimeSheet.getHeight()/FRAME_ROWS );
        slimeIdleFrames = new TextureRegion[FRAME_COLS*FRAME_ROWS];
        int index = 0;
        for(int i = 0; i < 6; i++){
            for(int j = 0; j < 4; j++){
                slimeIdleFrames[index++] = tmp[i][j];
            }
        }
        slimeAnimation = new Animation(0.025f, slimeIdleFrames);
        stateTime = 0f;
    }

    @Override
    public void render() {
        ScreenUtils.clear(0.15f, 0.15f, 0.2f, 1f);

        stateTime += Gdx.graphics.getDeltaTime();
        currentFrame = (TextureRegion) slimeAnimation.getKeyFrame(stateTime, true);
        batch.begin();
        batch.draw(currentFrame, 0, 0);
        batch.end();
    }

    @Override
    public void dispose() {
        batch.dispose();
        slimeSheet.dispose();
    }
}

I would be interested to learn why this problem causes this error (because it worked in my last project).

answers.body:
You're indexing out-of-bounds for the slimeIdleFrames array.

The slineIdleFrames array is initialized to

slimeIdleFrames = new TextureRegion[FRAME_COLS*FRAME_ROWS];

where FRAME_COLS and FRAME_ROWS are both set to two:

private static final int FRAME_COLS = 2;
private static final int FRAME_ROWS = 2;

But in the loop you are iterating past 4 (2 * 2):

    int index = 0;
    for(int i = 0; i < 6; i++){
        for(int j = 0; j < 4; j++){
            slimeIdleFrames[index++] = tmp[i][j];
        }
    }

If you set the constants to 6 and 4 it should work:

private static final int FRAME_COLS = 6;
private static final int FRAME_ROWS = 4;
